items.summary: Ensure the API Configuration modal dialog is visible and accessible in the UI. The Header component must render the 'API Config' button for admin users, and clicking it must open the ApiConfigDialog modal.

The API Configuration dialog must contain: a bold 'API Configuration' title, an 'API Endpoint URL' text input field, an 'API Key' password input field with character masking, a gray outlined 'Cancel' button, and a solid blue 'Save' button. Pre-fill the fields with any existing values loaded from the backend.

Ensure the backend actor exposes a stable API configuration endpoint that accepts and persists an API endpoint URL and API key, and returns them when queried. Verify the external API config getter and setter functions are correctly defined in main.mo and that the migration module handles the combined ExternalApiConfig record shape.
